result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey M. SCHERER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to L and B Pawn at 1022 South 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

Submit a DNA sample.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey M. SCHERER

records.addlTxt: Plea date on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.

Attorney Engstrom is requesting the cash bail set in each case be converted to signature bonds.  Defendant would also be willing to have a condition of a daily report date.
State objects to the request and presents arguments.
Court believes cash bail is appropriate and modifies the $1,000.00 cash bonds in 15 CF 667 and 15 CF 668 to $500.00 cash and continues the $500.00 cash bond in 15 CF 669.  Conditions remain the same.
Attorney Engstrom is directed to prepare the Order.

Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.

RE:  Bail jumping, on 11-02-15.
Initial appearance is set for 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of theft, obstruct officer, theft by fraud and burglary.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Harold G. Toms, Nathan C. Korinek or 2314 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI and Judith A. Engelbrecht or 910 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
